lessons.title: Lesson 1: What is a hobby?
lessons.content: Definition and examples of hobbies. A hobby is an activity that you do for pleasure in your free time.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Talking about your hobbies
lessons.content: How to talk about your hobbies in English: I like/ I enjoy/ My hobby is...

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Popular hobbies
lessons.content: Learn vocabulary and sentences for popular hobbies: playing football, reading books, gardening, collecting stamps.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Describing frequency
lessons.content: Learn how to say how often you do your hobbies: always, often, sometimes, never.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Health vocabulary
lessons.content: Useful words for health: healthy, exercise, diet, sleep, illness.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Talking about habits
lessons.content: How to talk about healthy and unhealthy habits: I always brush my teeth. I never skip breakfast.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Giving advice
lessons.content: Using should/shouldn't to give advice: You should exercise every day. You shouldn't eat too much fast food.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: What is community service?
lessons.content: Community service means helping people or the environment without getting paid.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Talking about volunteer activities
lessons.content: Learn phrases for discussing community service: help clean the park, teach children, donate clothes.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Musical instruments
lessons.content: Vocabulary for musical instruments: piano, guitar, violin, drums, flute.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Talking about music preferences
lessons.content: How to say what kind of music you like: I love pop music. I prefer classical music.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Food vocabulary
lessons.content: Learn common food and drink vocabulary: rice, noodles, chicken, vegetables, juice.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Ordering food
